alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette, northwestern St. Martin and southeastern St. Landry Parishes through 1030 AM CDT... At 959 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cankton, or near Carencro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Scott, Carencro, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Sunset, Grand Coteau, Cankton, Cecilia and Atchafalaya National Wildlife Refuge. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 2 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central and south central Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
